subject: NLP
syllabus:
1. Basics of Textual Data

Bag of words and N-grams, Keyword / key phrase extraction, Document Term Model (TF-IDF), Bernoulli and Binomial Document Models: Representation a document as a vector, Representing a document collection as matrix, Python for Text processing: Vectors & Word2Vec, Dimensionality Reduction & DIMSUM, Hidden Markov and Maximum Entropy Models    

[No of hours: 10]    

2. Speech

Phonetics, Speech Synthesis, Automatic Speech Recognition, Part of Speech Tagging: Stanford Parser, Open NLP, Entity extraction: Keyword based entity extraction, Rule based entity extraction, Machine learning for entity extraction, Visualization of Textual Data: Word cloud, Word clusters, Word to entity relationship.    

[No of hours: 10]    

3. Modeling Techniques:

Topic Discovery using clustering and latent models, Text Classification, Sentiment Analysis, Naive Bayes, Logistic Regression and Support Vector Machines, Summarization / key sentence extraction, Storing and Access of Text Data: MongoDB, Searching on text data.    

[No of hours: 12]    

4. Semantics and Pragmatics: The Representation of Meaning, Computational Semantics, Lexical Semantics, Computational Lexical Semantics Semantics: Wordnet for discovery of semantics, Semantic search, Subject Object relationship extraction. Applications: Information Extraction, Question Answering and Summarization, Dialogue and Conversational Agents, Machine Translation    

[No of hours: 10]

subject: AML
syllabus:
1.  Factor Analysis

Confirmatory Vs. Explanatory, Principal Component Analysis

[No of hours:4]    

2.  Dimensionality Reduction - Introduction

Reduces Overfitting, Avoiding multicollinearity, Noisy and Parse data, Trade-off between accuracy and training time

3.  Dimensionality Reduction - Methods

[No of hours:5]

Factor Analysis, Principal Component Analysis (PCA), Linear Discriminant Analysis (LDA), Singular Value Decomposition (SVD)

[No of hours: 4]

4.  Latent Variables and its use in Machine Learning

Observable Variables vs. Latent Variables, Hidden nature, cannot be observed but inferred, Factor Analysis, Hidden Markov Models (HMM), Expectation Maximization (EM)

[No of hours:5]

5.  Generalized Linear Models

Difference with Linear Regression, Different link functions like normal, binomial, categorical,etc.

[No of hours: 5]

6.  Support Vector Machines

[No of hours: 5]

Hyperplanes and Support Vectors Support vector regression, Kernel methods, Cost Function and Gradient Update

7.  Genetic Algorithms (GA)

[No of hours: 4]

Biological Background Of Genetic Algorithms, Correlation Of A Chromosome With GA, Important Terminology In GA, Roulette Wheel and others, Crossover & Mutation, Stopping Genetic Algorithm

8.  Ensemble Methods

[No of hours:4]

Bagging Methods, Boosting Methods, Differences and Similarities

9.  Explainable Models

[No of hours:4]

Degree of explainability across various algorithms, Domain specific explainability requirements

10. Ethics in Data Science

[No of hours:4]

Identification and adjusting bias, Data Privacy and Data Protection, Ethically Aligned design

subject: Discrete Mathematics
syllabus:
Logic and Proofs
Propositional logic, Predicate logic, Propositional equivalences, Normal Forms, Predicate and Quantifiers, Nested Quantifiers, Rules of Inference, Introduction to Proofs, Proof Methods and Strategy.

[No of hours: 10]

Basic Structures
Sets, Set Operations, Functions, Sequences and Summations

[No of hours: 8]

Number Theory and Cryptography
Integers and division, Primes and Greatest Common Divisors, Integers and Algorithms, Applications of Number Theory, Cryptography

[No of hours: 8]

Induction and Recursion
Mathematical Induction, Recursive Definitions and Structural Induction

[No of hours: 8]

Counting
The Basics of Counting, The Pigeonhole Principle, Permutations and Combinations, Binomial Coefficients and Identities, Generalized Permutations and Combinations   

[No of hours: 10]

Graph Theory
Graphs and Graph Models, Graph Terminology and Special Types of Graphs, Representing Graphs and Graph Isomorphism, Connectivity, Euler and Hamiltonian Paths, Shortest-Path Problems, Planar Graphs, Graph Coloring   

[No of hours: 8]

subject: Web Application Design and Developement
syllabus:
1.  Internet and the World Wide Web:    

What is the Internet?    

Introduction to the internet and its applications, E-mail, telnet, FTP, e-commerce, video conferencing, e-business.    

Internet service providers, domain name server, internet address, World Wide Web (WWW): World Wide Web and its evolution, uniform resource locator (URL), browsers - internet explorer, Netscape navigator, opera, Firefox, chrome, Mozilla.    

search engine, web saver - apache, IIS, proxy server, HTTP protocol.    

HTML5: Introduction, Why HTML5?    

Formatting text by using tags, using lists and backgrounds, Creating hyperlinks and anchors.    

Style sheets, CSS formatting text using style sheets, formatting paragraphs using style sheets.    

HTML5 Page layout and navigation    

[No of hours: 9]    

Creating navigational aids: planning site organization, creating text based navigation bar, creating graphics based navigation bar, creating graphical navigation bar, creating image map, redirecting to another URL, creating division based layouts: HTML5 semantic tags, creating divisions, creating HTML5 semantic layout, positioning and formatting divisions.    

HTML5 Tables, Forms and Media:    

Creating tables: creating simple table, specifying the size of the table, specifying the width of the column, merging table cells, using tables for page layout, formatting tables: applying table borders, applying background and foreground fills, changing cell padding, spacing and alignment, creating user forms: creating basic form, using check boxes and option buttons, creating lists, additional input types in HTML5, Incorporating sound and video: audio and video in HTML5, HTML multimedia basics, embedding video clips, incorporating audio on web page.    
2.  Java Script    

[No of hours:8]    

Introduction, Client-Side JavaScript, Server-Side JavaScript, JavaScript Objects, JavaScript Security.    

Operators:    

Assignment Operators, Comparison Operators, Arithmetic Operators, % (Modulus), ++(Increment), --(Decrement), -(Unary Negation), Logical Operators, Short-Circuit Evaluation, String Operators, Special Operators, ?: (Conditional operator),, (Comma operator), delete, new, this, void    

Operators, % (Modulus), ++(Increment), --(Decrement), -(Unary Negation), Logical Operators, Short-Circuit Evaluation, String Operators, Special Operators, ?: (Conditional operator), (Comma operator), delete, new, this, void
